 Amendo Tech är din heltäckande partner inom IT och tech. Som vår konsultkollega blir du en del av ett personligt bolag som lägger stor vikt vid kompetens, mångfald och innovation. Vi ser varje medarbetares unika perspektiv som en styrka, och vi erbjuder ett öppet klimat där vi stöttar dig att nå dina mål. Tillsammans bidrar vi till att forma en bättre framtid genom teknik och kreativitet.
   

  

 Vi är ett expansivt bolag med stark lokal närvaro i Stockholm samt i sydvästra och norra Sverige. Följ Amendo Tech på Linkedin!
   

  

 Amendo Tech är en del av Amendo Group som har arbetat med framtidens kompetens sedan 2001. I koncernen ingår även Amendo Bemanning & Rekrytering och Lagotto Executive Search & Interim. Tillsammans möter vi dig där du står, och tar dig dit du vill. Vi är din engagerade och trygga kompetenspartner.
   

  

 Frågor och kontakt
   

  

 Vid frågor eller funderingar om våra konsultuppdrag är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till Amendo Techs Kiara Bergqvist på kiara.bergqvist@amendotech.se eller Johanna Hallenberg på johanna.hallenberg@amendotech.se. Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig, varmt välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 #IT

title: Engineering Manager Webstore
description:
**Create moments that matter. Decode the future.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

 Join us in our exciting quest to build the future home!
   

  

**All about the role:**
 We are looking for a highly skilled Engineering Manager to lead the Webstore E-commerce team, driving the development and optimisation of our digital commerce platforms. This role requires a strong full-stack technology background across both CMS and E-commerce technologies, ensuring scalable, high-performance solutions that enhance customer experience and business growth.
   

  

 As an Engineering Manager, you will be responsible for team leadership, technical excellence, vendor management, and driving best practices in the software development lifecycle (SDLC). You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including product managers, Product owners, and external partners, to deliver high-quality, resilient, and innovative e-commerce solutions.
   

  

 You should be able to thrive in a composable enterprise landscape, embracing modular architecture principles, driving the adoption of the latest technological advancements in the Customer Experience (CX) domain, and ensuring that our platforms remain agile and future-proof.
   

  

 You will be reporting to the Senior Engineering Manager Sales for D2C.
   

  

**What you’ll do:**
 Leadership & Team Management
   

  

* Plan headcount and hire for the required technical competencies, ensuring strong expertise in E-commerce platforms with a good understanding of CMS.
* Own the budget and forecasting for the Webstore e-commerce engineering function.
* Oversee team planning, balancing horizontal technical responsibilities (platform, coding practices, SDLC improvements) and vertical product delivery.
* Foster a strong engineering culture through team meetings, communities of practice, career planning, and regular 1:1s.
* Drive team productivity and optimise resource utilization, ensuring continuous improvement in SDLC through test & release automation and observability.
* Manage and collaborate with software vendors of the platforms under your scope.
* Partner with delivery partners to ensure successful project execution.
* Drive the adoption of emerging technologies in the CX domain, leveraging best practices in a composable enterprise environment.


 Technical Ownership & Execution:
   

  

* Own and drive technical decisions across both CMS and E-commerce platforms within the Webstore domain.
* Provide hands-on coding and configuration support as needed, ensuring best practices and code quality.
* Identify, prioritise, and execute technology enablers, including platform upgrades, tenant architecture design, and feature enablers.
* Actively lead the execution of the product roadmap and delivery, working closely with Product Managers to align business and technology goals.
* Own and maintain the architecture and technical design, ensuring scalability, security, and maintainability of the Webstore E-commerce platforms.
* Jointly responsible with the Product Manager for managing the Total Cost of Ownership (TCO), balancing innovation with operational efficiency.
* Champion composable commerce principles, ensuring modular and API-first approaches that improve flexibility, scalability, and interoperability.


**Qualifications & Experience**
* Proven experience as an Engineering Manager or Technical Lead in e-commerce, with deep expertise in e-commerce applications and platforms.
* Strong full-stack development background, with expertise in both frontend (React, Vue.js, etc.) and backend (Node.js, Java, .NET, etc.) technologies.
* Extensive knowledge and hands-on experience with CMS applications (e.g. Optimizely) and a strong understanding of their role in modern e-commerce ecosystems.
* In-depth experience with microservices architecture, API-first strategies, and composable enterprise principles, including MACH (Microservices, API-first, Cloud-native, Headless) architectures.
* Strong experience in cloud-native development and infrastructure (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
* Expertise in CI/CD, test automation, observability, and DevOps practices to drive engineering efficiency and product stability.
* Experience in vendor and partner management, ensuring seamless collaboration with software and platform providers.
* Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to bridge engineering and business stakeholders effectively.
* Passionate about Customer Experience (CX) technology and driving innovation in digital commerce to enhance user engagement and business impact.


**Who you are:**
* Bachelor's or higher degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field.
* 7+ years of experience in e-commerce engineering, overseeing technical teams and driving software development in a direct-to-consumer (D2C) environment.
* Proven expertise in E-commerce platforms and CMS solutions (e.g., Optimizely), with a strong understanding of their integration within modern digital commerce ecosystems.
* Deep technical background in full-stack development, with proficiency in frontend frameworks (React, Vue.js, Angular) and backend technologies (Node.js, Java, .NET, or equivalent).
* Strong knowledge of microservices architecture, API-first design, and composable commerce principles (MACH architecture – Microservices, API-first, Cloud-native, Headless).
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP), including infrastructure management, scalability, and cost optimization.
* Strong DevOps, CI/CD, and test automation experience, ensuring high code quality, observability, and efficient software releases.
* Demonstrated ability to lead teams in agile, cross-functional, and globally distributed environments, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Vendor and partner management experience, with the ability to assess, negotiate, and manage relationships with software and service providers.
* A strong business and product mindset, with the ability to translate technical challenges into business opportunities and align engineering efforts with strategic objectives.
* Passion for Customer Experience (CX) technologies, continuously exploring emerging trends in digital commerce, personalization, and user engagement.
* Fluent English


**You demonstrate**
* ENERGY – Deliver Results. Leading others & self. Ambition & Drive
* OPENESS – Consumer & Customer Focus. Cross Collaboration & Networking
* AGILITY – Adaptability. Judgement & Decision Making. Acumen.
* GROWTH – Innovation & Curiosity. Coaching Others and Self. Learning Ability)


**Where you'll be:**
 This is a full-time position, based at the Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden)
   

  

**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**
**Find out more on:** 
 ElectroluxGroup: https://www.linkedin.com/company/electrolux/life/lifeatelectrolux

title: Domänarkitekt
description:
Vill du forma framtidens molnlandskap med oss? Så bra! Vi söker nu en erfaren Domänarkitekt med gedigen kunskap inom systemdesign och infrastruktur. Hos oss får du en nyckelroll i en spännande molnresa, där du kombinerar strategi med teknik och samarbetar med några av branschens skarpaste utvecklingsteam. Tillsammans bygger vi framtidssäkra och innovativa lösningar!
   

  

**Vad kommer du att göra?**
 Som Domänarkitekt hos oss blir du en central spelare i vår pågående cloudresa där du leder molntransformationen för team Konto & Tjänster Tur. Du ansvarar för att mappa domänens system på den gemensamma referensarkitekturen och plattformen och säkerställer att våra system är optimerade och väl dokumenterade.
   

  

 Du blir en del av en engagerad tech-organisation med flera agila team som inkluderar systemutvecklare, mjukvaruarkitekter, produktägare och testare. Vi kombinerar egenutvecklade system och plattformar med inköpta tjänster och arbetar tätt ihop med våra core-plattformar.
   

  

 Det innebär att rollen spänner över ett brett spektrum, från strategisk planering till teknisk implementering, och du blir en nyckelspelare i att forma vårt ekosystem för framtiden där vårt egenutvecklade kundkontosystem är centralt.
   

  

 Du representerar domänen i våra centrala arkitektforum, där du samarbetar med andra arkitekter, utvecklingsteam, produktägare och affärsutvecklare. Ditt arbete kommer att omfatta hela kedjan från tekniska lösningar och systemdesign till FinOps och kostnadsoptimering, vilket ger dig en nyckelroll i att säkerställa en hållbar och framtidssäker molnplattform.
   

  

**Är du den som kommer att göra det?**
 För att lyckas i den här rollen behöver du vara analytisk, lösningsorienterad och strategisk, med en förmåga att både se helheten och förstå detaljerna. Du är strukturerad och kan bryta ner komplexa problem till tydliga strategier. Samtidigt har du ett strategiskt mindset och ser de stora dragen utan att missa det viktiga i detaljerna.
   

  

 Kommunikation är en av dina styrkor – du kan översätta tekniska lösningar till affärsnytta och göra dem begripliga för både tekniska och icke-tekniska stakeholders. Du är proaktiv, ser möjligheter och tar initiativ för att driva förändring framåt. Dessutom trivs du i samarbete med andra, bygger relationer och gillar att jobba tvärfunktionellt.
   

  

 Vi Söker Dig Som Har Gedigen Erfarenhet Av Google Cloud Och Expertis Inom Systemdesign Och Infrastruktur Där Du Kan Rita Upp Och Visualisera Komplexa System. Du Har
   

  

* Kunskap inom FinOps – du har erfarenhet av kostnadsoptimering, kapacitetsplanering och molnekonomi
* Erfarenhet av DevOps och automatisering – du har god förståelse för CI/CD, Infrastructure as Code (IaC) och modern utvecklingspraxis
* Kunskap om säkerhet & compliance i molnet – du har koll på best practices och regelverk
* Bakgrund inom systemutveckling – en förståelse för operativ drift är en fördel


****Om Tech på Svenska Spel****
 Vi hanterar dagligen stora transaktionsvolymer, och våra system är byggda för hög prestanda, skalbarhet och tillgänglighet. Vi är ett techbolag i framkant, där innovation och optimering av molnlösningar är en central del av vår strategi. Varje dag utvecklar, driftar och supportar vi ett av världens mest avancerade spelsystem. Det här kommer med ett ansvar, både för folkets drömmar och spänning, men även för deras spelande. Vi flyttar ständigt fram gränserna för vår tech och låter aldrig vår Drömmaskin stå still. Kom och utveckla den med oss!
   

  

**Vi är Svenska Spel**
 Svenska Spel är hela Sveriges spelbolag. Vi skapar hållbara och roliga spelupplevelser som bidrar till ett bättre Sverige. Genom spel som Triss, Stryktipset och Oddset ger vi våra fyra miljoner kunder spänning, glädje och drömmar. Våra spel är enkla och trygga och oavsett om man spelar online eller fysiskt, själv eller tillsammans med andra, så ska upplevelsen alltid vara positiv. Vi vill att fler ska spela hållbart hos oss och vår verksamhet ska bedrivas på ett socialt, ekonomiskt och miljömässigt ansvarsfullt sätt. Varje år går överskottet till statskassan. Vi är Sveriges största idrottssponsor och investerar nära 300 miljoner kronor årligen i svensk idrott. Vi är modiga, nyfikna och strävar efter enkelhet i allt vi gör samt skapar resultat tillsammans.
   

  

*Är du nyfiken på våra förmåner? Då hittar du dem här!*
**A** 
**nsökan och kontaktuppgifter**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning med placering i Stockholm eller i Visby med möjlighet till flexibelt distansarbete. På Svenska Spel gör vi jobbet där det passar bäst - ibland är det hemma och ibland på kontoret. Just nu finns vårt Stockholmskontor i Solna men i maj 2025 flyttar vi in i nya, härliga lokaler vid Slussen i centrala Stockholm.
   

  

 Vi jobbar löpande med urval och intervjuer så tveka inte med att skicka in din ansökan redan idag.
   

  

 För frågor om tjänsten, kontakta Jenny Mattsson, jenny.mattsson@svenskaspel.se
   

  

 För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Team Talent Acquisition, teamta@svenskaspel.se

title: IT Solution Architect - Business Information Systems / Sharepoint / PowerBI / Azure
description:
NTT DATA is currently looking for a Solution Architect for an EU agency in Stockholm.
 



 Your role:
 


* Plans, designs and integrates IT system components including hardware, software and services.


* Focus area: Business Information Systems such as PRIME, ECMP, PHE Intranet with focus on SharePoint Online, Power Platform, Power BI, Azure technologies.
* Support the development and implementation of long-term strategies in the required domain (business process, information, application and technology)
* Define and design as-is and to-be models for the domain
* Define and develop architecture frameworks, concepts and methods
* Describe and analyse as-is situations in the domains
* Facilitate development work with architecture support
* Communicate and explain architecture deliverables
* Create and maintain models in Sparx Enterprise Architect (or other tools)
* Ensure incorporation of security by design
* Develop and maintain a comprehensive record of usability requirements
* Develop relevant IT Products.



 Your profile:
 


* University degree with minimum 6 years of experience in IT OR non university degree with minimum 12 years of experience in IT
* Minimum 3 years of experience in enterprise architecture or domain architectures (business process, information, application and technology)
* Experience with DevOps practices, CI/CD and automation
* Programming/scripting experience
* Experience in the application of enterprise architecture frameworks and methods (TOGAF)
* Experience with architecture practices in at least one domain (business process, information, application and technology)
* Experience in modelling languages and concepts (e.g. ArchiMate)
* Experience in teamwork facilitation and consulting
* Knowledge in public health
* Knowledge of design patterns in big data, cloud solutions (Azure) and artificial intelligence
* Experience in enterprise transformation projects
* Experience in designing, maintaining and implementing an IT strategy
* Experience using relevant IT architecture tools (e.g. Sparx Enterprise Architect)
* Experience expressing complex technical concepts effectively, both verbally and in writing
* Experience working well with people from many different disciplines with varying degrees of technical knowledge
* Optional certifications: TOGAF (The Open Group Architecture Framework), SABSA (Sherwood Applied Business Security Architecture) or ArchiMate



 Language skills:
   

 You are fluent in English.
 



 NTT DATA - a part of NTT Group - is a trusted global innovator of IT and business services headquartered in Tokyo. We help clients transform through consulting, industry solutions, business process services, IT modernization and managed services. NTT DATA enables clients, as well as society, to move confidently into the digital future. We are committed to our clients' long-term success and combine global reach with local client attention to serve them in over 50 countries. Visit us at nttdata.com

title: Solution Engineer IIoT – Stockholm
description:
Sweden, Stockholm



Technical

  


### **Your challenge**



The Solution Engineer is the technical conscience of our sales force. You make sure the offered solutions are technically correct and you advise on the used applications at customers. Without you, the market will not move forward into Smart Industry!


### **Your responsibility**



In your role as Solution Engineer, you are there to make sure everyone sells and uses our products in the right way. You provide technical support, primarily during the pre-sales stage. acting as the go-to expert for both your sales colleagues and customers, helping them find the best possible solutions. Next to your “core-business”, you are there for all kinds of technical support. This includes working with demo kits for trade shows, attending customer meetings to introduce our products and solutions, and collaborating with colleagues on project management tasks.


All this combined makes you the technical hub of the sales team. If you don’t know the solution, then who will? Luckily, you’ll be part of a network of Solution Engineers across Europe, with whom you can share experiences and collaborate to find the best solutions! This position may also involve travel within and beyond the Nordics region.


### **Who are you?**



There is not much about Industrial Automation and Computer Technology you do not know. We can sum up a list of demands, but in the end, it’s most important that you understand where IT and OT come together:

  



* Technical education (Degree in Computer Science, Electronics, Automation, or a related field).
* Strong social and communication skills with a customer-centric approach.
* Good teamwork and project management skills to collaborate effectively with various departments within Advantech.
* Strong understanding of computer architecture, including CPU/GPU, memory systems, PCIe, SATA, USB, Ethernet, CAN bus, RS-232/422/485, and GPIO interfaces.
* Familiarity with industrial computing standards/protocols (e.g., Ethercat, Modbus, OPC-UA).
* Experience with Windows IoT, Linux (Ubuntu, Yocto, RedHat), and RTOS (Real-Time Operating Systems).
* Virtualization knowledge (VMware, Hyper-V, Docker, KVM) for edge and cloud computing.
* Understanding of UEFI/BIOS customization, secure boot, and TPM (Trusted Platform Module) security.
* Hands-on experience with server management tools like BMC, IPMI, and Redfish technologies.
* Experience with industrial networking (4G/5G, LoRa, Zigbee) and IoT protocols, like MQTT.
* Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to work independently and collaboratively.
* Willingness to travel to customer sites, sometimes on short notice.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English. Finnish is a plus.
### **How do we see the future?**



Our mission is to enable an intelligent planet. As Solution Engineer, you can facilitate that mission! And just as you can help us provide tailor made products that exactly match the requirements of our customers, we can help you develop your career.


### **Who is Advantech**



Advantech is the world leader when it comes to industrial and embedded automation. The Internet of Things and Industry 4.0 are growing exponentially and we are one of the driving forces behind it. Next to being proud for our success by representing best in Class Company products, our employees are truly inspired every day by our multi-cultural international environment with more than 45 different nationalities. Advantech is a financial stable and successful market leader. Attention is paid to both your technical as well as personal development, with above average career opportunities.

  

  

*At Advantech, we care about your added value to our company and our culture. We welcome all people to apply at our open company, disregarding race, religion, sexuality or gender (m/f/d). Advantech has zero tolerance for any form of discrimination.*

title: Integration Specialist and Product Manager
description:
Be visionary
Teledyne Technologies Incorporated provides enabling technologies for industrial growth markets that require advanced technology and high reliability. These markets include aerospace and defense, factory automation, air and water quality environmental monitoring, electronics design and development, oceanographic research, deepwater oil and gas exploration and production, medical imaging and pharmaceutical research.
We are looking for individuals who thrive on making an impact and want the excitement of being on a team that wins.  

Job Description  

Your Key Responsibilities  

As an Integration Manager, you will:* Partner with global customers to scope, plan, and implement our enterprise solutions, system-to-system integrations and drive the customer onboarding process.
* Lead customer workshops, training sessions, and user acceptance testing to ensure successful implementations and long-term value creation.
* Collaborate with internal teams (Product Management, Sales, Support, and R&D) to deliver successful projects and ensure alignment with customer goals.
* Develop an in-depth understanding of customer needs, IT environments, and system requirements to set up effective integrations between our solutions and customer CMMS/EAM/ERP systems.
* Act as a technical integration expert, supporting sales efforts by providing technical insights during the sales cycle and customer visits.
* Build extensive expertise in sensor integration, data flows, and creating structures that maximize customer value.
* Work closely with product managers to refine our offerings and develop additional integration solutions and packages.
* Support cross-functional teams to improve documentation, support materials, training resources, and communication strategies.
* Create and maintain a network of experts on other CMMS/EAM systems, contributing to future product enhancements and customer projects.
* Benchmark competitive solutions and provide insights to product management for market-driven innovation.


What We’re Looking For  

To excel in this role, you’ll need:* A bachelor’s or master’s degree in engineering or a related field.
* Proven experience in setting up system-to-system integrations through APIs, system configurations, customizations, or middleware.
* Excellent technical skills in system integrations and data management, with a strong understanding of cloud hosting options (multi-tenant, single-tenant, and on-prem).
* A background in Software as a Service (SaaS) is highly desirable.
* Outstanding customer relationship management and communication skills, with the ability to present complex technical concepts clearly to all levels of an organization.
* Strong project management skills, ensuring efficient and professional customer implementation processes.
* Flexibility to travel internationally, accounting for 20-50% of your time.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken, to communicate effectively within our global organization as well as our international customers and teams.


Why Join Us at Teledyne FLIR?
As an Integration Manager, you’ll have the unique opportunity to shape the future of enterprise solutions by driving customer success and contributing to innovative product offerings. By collaborating closely with global customers, you’ll gain deep market insights while evolving and streamlining customer implementation processes for maximum efficiency.
At Teledyne FLIR, you’ll:* Develop your career with the world's leading company in thermal imaging and sensing technology.
* Play a pivotal role in building enterprise solutions that deliver success for both our customers and the company.
* Enjoy a dynamic work environment where our broad range of products and sensors come together to create impactful solutions.
* Thrive in a friendly, collaborative culture that emphasizes creativity, problem-solving, and teamwork.


If you’re driven, structured, and passionate about creating exceptional customer experiences, we’d love to have you on our team!
Interested?
If you liked what you just read, and believe you are the person that will make us better, do not hesitate to apply.
The selection process is ongoing and we may select our final candidate before the advert expires.
When applying, make it easy for yourself. Add a resume and fill out the required fields, no need to add anything else at this point.
We accept applications in English
(Non-US) This position requires access to export-controlled information or items (i.e. regulated technology or technical data per ITAR/EAR US regulations). Applicants must be eligible to apply for and obtain the appropriate export control license from the U.S. Departments of State or Commerce.  

Teledyne and all of our employees are committed to conducting business with the highest ethical standards. We require all employees to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, rules and regulatory orders. Our reputation for honesty, integrity and high ethics is as important to us as our reputation for making innovative sensing solutions.
.

title: Pre-Sales Engineer / Sales Engineer, Nordics (Application Security)
description:
Thales people architect identity management and data protection solutions at the heart of digital security. Business and governments rely on us to bring trust to the billons of digital interactions they have with people. Our technologies and services help banks exchange funds, people cross borders, energy become smarter and much more. More than 30,000 organizations already rely on us to verify the identities of people and things, grant access to digital services, analyze vast quantities of information and encrypt data to make the connected world more secure.**Title:** PreSales Engineer / Sales Engineer, Nordics (Application Security)  

**Location:** Remote Sweden

 **The Opportunity**  

Due to our growth and our recent acquisition of Imperva, Thales are looking for a customer-centric Sales Engineer (SE) to join the Nordics Field Sales Team, to be based in Sweden.  

  

You will be supporting an award-winning Enterprise Field Sales Team who consistently hit their commission accelerators so we are looking for an exceptionally talented, motivated Application Security Sales Engineer to bring their 'A game' and join a successful Team.  

  

Imperva within Thales is a pioneer and leader of a new category of business security solutions for critical applications and high-value data in the data center. Thousands of the world’s leading businesses, government organizations, and service providers rely on Thales’ solutions to protect against data breaches, meet compliance mandates, and manage data risk.  

  

The Sales Engineer (SE) will work alongside the Regional Sales Managers, as part of the Nordics Field Sales Team and oversee the sales support of Thales entire Application Security portfolio to existing and prospective customers within the assigned geographic region. The SE is an integral part of the sales organization and assists the sales team with pre-sales technical knowledge, presentations, demonstrations, workshops, and POVs. They work closely with sales managers, prospects and partners as subject-matter experts to demonstrate how proposed solutions meet and exceed customer requirements.


Working in a tiered sales ecosystem, the Sales Engineer is also responsible for interacting with and maintaining the partner’s and distributor’s SE’s knowledge, relationships and supporting them in the selling of Thales solutions.  

  

**Responsibilities:**

* Participate in sales conference calls and prospect visits, provide product demonstrations in person and remotely, and working with prospects at both a technical and business level to show how Thales’ Application Security solutions deliver value to them.
* Possess demonstrable skills in customer-centric selling and a proven track record using it to help drive revenue.
* Participate as a technical resource at trade shows and conferences, when needed.
* Work independently and as a vital member of a sales team.
* Work with the sales team to strategize on sales approaches to develop business.
* Ensure successful on-site product evaluations when necessary.
* Manage the Regional Strategic Account customer base on their technical needs.
* Plan, manage and execute customer product pilots.
* Directly support the sales process with partner SEs and partner generated opportunities
* Manage the Regional Strategic Partner Engineering community and help address technical needs.
* Understand and keep up to date on competitive advantages vs Thales’ main competitors, and have the ability to articulate them in favor of the partner’s opportunities, as well as during training sessions.
* Aid in the creation, evaluation and answering of RFI/RFPs considering competitive information and key advantages of Thales’ solutions
* Collaborate with Thales’ Partner’s team to drive partner official certification activities and metrics
* Engage with technical support and escalations inside Thales when necessary to expedite critical incidents and support key customers or partners with the intent of reaching a faster resolution.
* Jointly design, agree and execute commercial strategy with Account Executives or other colleagues assigned to the same region.
* Create content and execute activities to drive demand, such as Webinars, articles, posts, etc.
* Participate with field-based feedback in shaping the products SWOT analysis for the region, as well as managing Requests For Enhancement and engage with Product Management and Product Development when needed.

 **Qualifications:**

* BS degree in Computer Science or related field
* 8+ years of experience in network security, development, pre-sales engineering, or real world use of web application solutions; preferably with 5+ of these as a sales engineer and experience working in a start-up and vendor environment
* Must have excellent listening, presentation, demonstration, written, and oral communication skills
* Must be practiced in value based or consultative sales methodologies (ie.. Customer Centric Selling, Command of the Message, MEDDIC, SPIN, Value Selling, etc…)
* Possess a solid understanding of web applications, security, and auditing environments
* Knowledge in application development (ASP, .NET, PHP, JSP, NodeJS, Python)
* Knowledge in scripting (Python, Bash)
* Knowledge about APIs, REST, SOAP
* Knowledge in DNS protocol and service – an advantage
* Experience with Linux
* Deep knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, Load balancers, proxies and firewalls
* Knowledge of advanced internet route selection and/or tunneling protocols (BGP, GRE, etc) - an advantage
* Knowledge in SSL, TLS, cryptography and certificates
* Knowledge about containers, Kubernetes and service mesh – a significant advantage
* Experience working with public cloud solutions such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Microsoft Azure, and/or Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
* Cloud Certifications from ISC2(CCSP), AWS, Azure, or GCP – a significant advantage
* Compliance standards knowledge (PCI, SOX, HIPAA) – an advantage
* Able to effectively present technical material to small and large groups
* Experience with Network or Application Firewalls and/or IDS/IPS - an advantage
* Excellent time management, multi-tasking, and prioritization skills.
* Excellent written, oral communication and strong interpersonal, organizational and presentation skills
* Ability to travel up to 75%
* Experience with automation, scripting and/or using RegEx - an advantage
* English fluency is required & Swedish speaking will be value addition.


#LI-VJ1


At Thales we provide CAREERS and not only jobs. With Thales employing 80,000 employees in 68 countries our mobility policy enables thousands of employees each year to develop their careers at home and abroad, in their existing areas of expertise or by branching out into new fields. Together we believe that embracing flexibility is a smarter way of working. Great journeys start here, apply now!
company_description: Thales is a global technology leader with more than 77,000 employees on five continents, investing in digital and 'deep tech' innovations to build a future we can all trust.

title: Connected Services Product Manager
description:
*Every day, we get opportunities to make a positive impact – on our colleagues, partners,* *customers* *and society. Together,* *we’re* *pioneering the solutions of the future and unlocking the full potential of precious resources. Trusted to act on initiative, we challenge conventional thinking to develop world-leading technologies that inspire progress in vital areas, including energy, food,* *water* *and shipping.* *As we push forward, the innovative, open spirit that fuels our 140-year-old start-up culture and rapid growth also drives our personal growth. So, as we shape a more resourceful, less wasteful world, we build our careers too.*  

About the job
At Alfa Laval, we are dedicated to pushing the boundaries of technology by connecting our machinery to help customers keep their vessels compliant and efficient. Our mission is to explore and develop new services that will benefit both Alfa Laval and our clients. We are seeking a dedicated and skilled professional to become a part of our dynamic team and help drive our mission of innovation and excellence forward.  

Be a part of our exciting venture and help us shape the future of maritime solutions.  

Key Responsibilities:* Drive the continuous development of the connected marine services platform to meet customer needs.
* Navigate the complexity of developing new features, adding new applications to the platform, scaling up, while meeting today´s and future customer needs.
* Identify and analyse customer requirements to enhance the platform's offerings.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate new services and products into the platform.
* Monitor market trends and competitor activities to ensure our platform remains competitive.
* Develop and implement strategies to increase customer engagement and satisfaction.
* Provide training and support to internal teams and customers on new features and services.
* Support the team in daily activities, including customer interactions, training sessions, create necessary documentation, and marketing material.
  

What you know* Bachelor’s degree in engineering.
* Knowledge/Experience in the IoT principles (cloud development like Azure, databases, algorithm development, IT security, communication technologies)
* Experience with Agile methodologies preferred.
* Good communication skills and English language are required.
  

Who are you?* Interest in digitalization and the possibilities this gives to Alfa Laval.
* Have a mindset of setting the customer in focus, and identify how can we develop for the customers benefit.
* Dare to challenge the status quo, open and agile mindset.
* Able to drive change in a complex organization with multiple stakeholders.
* Be transparent and capable to communicated with a range of different stakeholders.
* Has a drive towards reaching target and completing activities.
  

What’s in it for you?
We offer a challenging position in an open and innovative environment. Your work will have a true impact for a sustainable future and Alfa Laval’s future success.  

About Alfa Laval in Tumba
Alfa Laval, currently located in the southern part of Stockholm in Tumba, is set to relocate during Spring 2025 to Flemingsberg, Sweden's largest urban business development area. Alfa Laval is shaping a vibrant and dynamic workplace that aims to inspire both existing and future employees. Additionally, this new site will provide an exceptional experience for employees, customers, and visitors.  

The focus at the new location will be on people, with modern offices and a digital workplace designed to enhance productivity and well-being. Furthermore, there will be a state-of-the-art high-tech lab dedicated to developing and testing products related to high-speed separation and emerging technologies.  

For further information, please contact:
Jimmie Karlsson, Global Sales and Technology Manager, jimmie.karlsson@alfalaval.com
Regina García Moguel, Talent Acquisition Partner, regina.garciamoguel@alfalaval.com  

Union information
Francisco Garcia, Akademikerföreningen, +46 733 995 684
Anders Jansson, Unionen, +46 730 780 482  

We review applications on a rolling basis, so we encourage you to submit yours by April 4th, 2025, at the latest. Please be aware that the application process may close earlier if we identify suitable candidates, so don’t delay in applying.  

Please note that, in compliance with GDPR, we cannot accept applications submitted via email.
#LI-RG1
company_description: Alfa Laval is a leading global supplier of products and solutions for heat transfer, separation and fluid handling through our key products – heat exchangers, separators, pumps and valves.

title: Juniora Analysts till Operations, Engineering, AI & Data (Stockholm) - Aug 2025
description:
**Företagsbeskrivning**
-----------------------

Deloitte är en globalt ledande leverantör av Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal och Consultative Services. Med mer än 457 000 medarbetare i över 150 länder hjälper vi våra klienter och vår omvärld att lösa komplexa problem och nå högt uppsatta mål. Det som definierar Deloitte är vår strävan efter att göra en meningsfull skillnad. För oss innebär det långsiktig utveckling och resultat för våra klienter och deras företag, idéer och handlingar, som också bidrar till en positiv samhällsutveckling. Det handlar även om att stärka våra medarbetare och främja deras utveckling.


**Om rollen**
-------------

Operations, Engineering, AI & Data stödjer våra klienter i att driva strategiska förändringsprojekt där vi implementerar affärsstrategier och utvecklar deras operationella förmågor för att hjälpa dem nå sina affärsmål. Vi arbetar med verksamhetsförändring där vi använder våra industrispecifika lösningar och tekniska kunskap för att transformera, modernisera och optimera våra klienters processer och tekniska plattformar.


**AI & Data:**

AI & Data-teamet hjälper våra kunder att förbättra beslutsfattande genom datadrivna insikter och skapa insiktsdrivna organisationer. I teamets tekniska spår arbetar vi med implementering av lösningar inom AI, GenAI, cloud data platforms, data warehouse, BI/analytics. Vi har starkt fokus på data science, där kompetenser inom maskininlärning, statistisk analys och modellering är centrala för att leverera avancerade insikter och affärsvärde. Vår modell är on-the-job-training där du växer in i mer ansvarsfulla roller, men du kommer också att vidareutbilda dig i olika tekniska plattformar, t.ex. Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Azure, Snowflake och/eller Databricks.


Vårt rådgivande spår i teamet jobbar med data management, data governance och datastrategi. Här ser vi gärna att du har en mer traditionell managementkonsultutbildning kombinerad med data och teknik samt ett intresse för att arbeta med rådgivning. AI & Data-teamet verkar i en nordisk organisation med mycket kunskapskapital och kompetens så du kommer också att medverka i projekt, communities och utbildningar tillsammans med dina nordiska kollegor.


**Engineering:**

Hos Engineering-teamet kommer ditt fokus ligga på att hjälpa våra kunder att transformera sin affär genom planering och implementation av kritiska verksamhetssystem och molnplattformar. Teamet kombinerar teknik- och affärsexpertis inom systemutveckling och molnplattformar med bred projektledningsförmåga samt djup branscherfarenhet inom flera sektorer. Därmed kan vi stödja våra kunder genom hela sin system- och affärstransformationsresa från början till slut oavsett vilken fas de befinner sig i. Vårt erbjudande inkluderar bland annat utveckling av strategier, skräddarsydda plattformar, modernisering av applikationer, alla aspekter av molnteknik samt rådgivning kring alla delar av en systemimplementation.


Som Analyst i vårt team kommer du vara en del av våra kunders resa genom att stötta med roller inom t.ex. kravställning, systemutveckling, testning & projektledning. Du kommer att skaffa dig erfarenhet både genom kundprojekt men även genom att delta vid branschevent, specialiserad utbildning och certifieringsprogram.


**Kravspecifikation**
---------------------

Vi söker dig som är nyexaminerad ingenjör, systemvetare eller ekonom med en masterexamen inom management, data/data science/analytics eller finans. För att trivas bra i rollen bör du även vara utåtriktad och initiativrik samt drivs av nya utmaningar.


Vidare ser vi gärna att du innehar:


* Goda studieresultat, internationell erfarenhet och relevant engagemang vid sidan av studierna
* Relevant arbetslivserfarenhet – erfarenhet från konsultbranschen är meriterande
* Mycket goda språkkunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och tillsammans i ett team, med målmedvetenhet, engagemang och driv
* Intresse för hur digitalisering och ny teknik kan utveckla verksamheter och branscher

Om du är osäker på om du uppfyller ovan kvalifikationer uppmuntrar vi dig att skicka in en ansökan ändå.


**Ytterligare information**
---------------------------

**Vi erbjuder**

Som en del av Deloitte får du tillgång till världens största konsultnätverk med kollegor världen över som du kan nyttja för att utveckla både dig själv, våra klienter och vår verksamhet. Du får arbeta med spännande, komplexa uppdrag, både på global och nordisk nivå, i ett team som alltid värderar ditt perspektiv och som är i framkant av digitaliseringen. Vi lägger stor vikt vid att erbjuda dig möjligheter att driva din personliga utveckling. Vi erbjuder dig praktisk erfarenhet, en personlig coach som långsiktigt stöttar dig i din karriär samt kontinuerlig feedback och support från mer erfarna kollegor.


Du får möjlighet att arbeta i ett företag som hjälper andra aktörer i deras resa mot en mer hållbar organisation, samtidigt som vi arbetar målmedvetet med våra egna ambitioner inom både klimat, miljö och socialt ansvar. Vi ser ett värde i att våra medarbetare har olika erfarenheter vilket främjar nytänkande och bidrar till fler perspektiv.


**Ansökan**

Du ansöker online. Din ansökan ska bestå av:


* CV
* En motivering till;
	+ Varför du är intresserad av Deloitte och rollen
	+ Vad du tror att du kan tillföra i rollen
* Betygskopior från högskola/universitet - De betyg som du laddar upp bör inte vara utdragna senare än 2 månader tillbaka i tiden.

Ladda gärna upp din motivering och dina betyg som ett dokument. CV laddas upp i första steget och de övriga dokumenten som efterfrågas laddas upp när du går vidare till nästa steg (ej i kommentarsfältet). Notera att du behöver ladda upp samtliga dokument för att din ansökan ska ses som fullständig. Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt då vi arbetar med löpande urval. **Om du söker flera tjänster hos oss ber vi dig att i dina ansökningar tydliggöra vilken roll du är mest intresserad av.**

Som ett kvalitativt led i Deloittes rekryteringsprocess genomgår våra slutkandidater en bakgrundskontroll, detta för att öka kännedomen om våra framtida medarbetare, trygga arbetsmiljön för våra medarbetare och möta regelkrav. Processen för bakgrundskontroller genomförs i samarbete med ToFindOut. https://tofindout.se/sv/faq/ . För de tjänster som Deloitte efterfrågar universitetsbetyg genomförs en verifiering som en del i rekryteringsprocessen. För frågor hänvisar vi till ansvarig rekryterare i processen.


**Frågor**

Om du har frågor om tjänsten eller om rekryteringsprocessen är du varmt välkommen att kontakta Johanna Aspegårdh ( jaspegardh@deloitte.se ).


Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


**What impact will you make?**

På Deloitte gör ditt arbete en meningsfull skillnad, varje dag, medan du växer i en inkluderande företagskultur av samarbete och hög prestation. Utöver att skapa lösningar strävar vi efter att göra en positiv och avgörande skillnad för andra i vår omgivning, våra klienter och samhället. På Deloitte hittar du tidigare dolda möjligheter att lyckas och inser din fulla potential.


**Arbetsplats**
---------------
company_description: We’re a leading professional services firm, but what makes working at Deloitte unique? When you join us, you become connected. To inspiring people. To meaningful work with fascinating clients.

title: Legal Counsel
description:
Job Title
Legal Counsel
Job Description*Are you a person with high degree of accountability, motivation and drive? Do you easily develop relationships of trust and confidence? Then this could something for you! We are now looking for a Legal Counsel that wants to join our fantastic Legal Team in Lund and contribute to our success journey forward.*
Who is your future team?
The Legal Team consists of experienced legal advisors with a deep understanding of Axis’ business. We work as an integral part of the daily business in close collaboration with our stakeholders. We support the Axis Group globally. Currently the team includes legal counsels, senior legal counsels, legal compliance specialists and a corporate governance specialist. Our goal is to support Axis’ sustainable and successful growth through tailor-made and strategical advice. Currently we are 12 driven and professional team members, all looking forward to meeting you!
What you will do here as a Legal Counsel
As Legal Counsel you will work both independently and in collaboration with your team members, contract managers as well as other colleagues within the Axis Group. The job will offer you a wide and global contact net and a variety of challenging work tasks on a cross-functional basis. This position requires a high degree of accountability, motivation and drive, and the ability to develop relationships of trust and confidence both within and outside of Axis. Your main responsibility will be to support the business with legal advice in a wide range of matters with R&D and Products, IT/IS, New Business and Sales/Marketing. The role will include tech legal compliance (e.g. GDPR, AI Act and Data Act). You will report to the Global Legal Director at HQ in Lund.
Your work tasks will include:* Working proactively to assess and manage legal risks and provide advice to business stakeholders.
* Drafting, reviewing, negotiating and providing advice on various commercial contracts and documents, such as development agreements, licensing, cloud services, NDAs and collaboration agreements.
* Participation in M&A-projects.
* To be part of the creation and communication of internal legal education and trainings.
* Drafting, implementing, and engaging in continuous work with template agreements and other steering documents promoted by the Legal Department.


Who are you?
We believe that you are a highly skilled, driven, analytical, structured, efficient and business oriented Legal Counsel that has a strong interest in IT/Tech law and related compliance matters. You can prioritize your work tasks and communicate complex legal assessments and advice in a clear and simple way. As a person you are motivated by working in a high-pace and rapidly moving global organization. You are used to working independently and make decisions.
You need to have:* A law degree (LL.M) from a Swedish University or equivalent.
* 3-5 years’ experience from working as in-house legal counsel or at a law firm.
* Strong analytical skills.
* A strong team-oriented approach.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with fluency in Swedish and English, both verbally and in writing.


What Axis has to offer
By joining Axis, you will embark on an exciting journey of personal and professional growth. We will offer you a great introduction to Axis with training. Our team will support you but also listen to your experiences and give you freedom to explore and realize your ideas. We are a fast-growing company that can offer you great career opportunities and a competitive package of benefits.
In exchange for your dedication, Axis offers you a job in an open, friendly, and professional environment. We work in an innovative and global organization that takes great pride in delivering world-class, high-quality products, services, and solutions to our customers. Working with us gives you an excellent opportunity to develop in an organization promoting professional and individual growth. You will have a role where your operational effort really will be of great impact to the overall success of Axis.
We want you to enjoy working with us, which is why we offer benefits such as flexible working hours, morning “fika” every day, Friday cake, company bonus, wellness allowance, health insurance and your very own Axis bicycle - to name a few.
We also provide a brand new training facility free for every Axis employee. You can see it here Axis HQ
We believe in sustainability, equality and inclusion. Read more here
Axis is an organization that values creativity and promotes teamwork and openness. With us you will grow both personally and professionally. You will be part of a team of great colleagues that enjoy going to work in the morning.
Curious to discover more?
We have a host of places where you can learn more about Axis, our products, solutions, company culture, and what working at Axis is really like.
Check out:  

Life at Axis blog
Engineering at Axis blog  

Innovation at Axis
Ready to Act?
Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity, something that is fundamental for our success. We welcome all applications.
I hope to see your application soon! If you have any questions about Axis or this job, don’t hesitate to contact Linda Hallencreutz, Global Legal Director, Linda.Hallencreutz@axis.com We review applications continuously.
Send us your application before April 15, 2025.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-04-14*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 4500 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.
Listen to Get To Know Axis – Podcast
company_description: Axis Communications is a global growth company with currently are about 4000 employees worldwide and offices in over 50 countries. We are expanding. Visit our webb page axis.com

title: Sales Manager, Nordics
description:
**Sales Manager - Growth Markets - Nordics**

  

**JOB PURPOSE:**


With full scope to sell across ADP's Payroll and HR solutions, this role also provides the infrastructure, presence and brand for sales leaders to orchestrate true, global conversations with organisations. You will work as part of the leadership team and with your sales team to define individual territory plans, focusing on new prospects in the Nordics. You inherit an established, but growing sales team. The types of deals that you get to work on will vary; it could be a 3-5 month process with 3/4 stakeholders, at €50-100,000 in year 1 revenue for a local only offering. Equally, it could be a longer, more complex, multi solution or country solution at several times the value.
  

  

With a world class induction programme, a leadership team offering best-in-breed expertise built from within ADP and the wider industry, and over 75 years of heritage and capability, the role offers the perfect platform for sales leaders and people, to succeed and develop.


**KEY RESPONSIBILITES**


* Responsible for the overall management, performance and development of the Nordics sales team in line with agreed sales strategy and overall business plan.
* Responsible for development and maintenance of comprehensive plan for team sales activity including pipeline and productivity. Will also manage both quota and non-commercial objectives for all individuals/team.
* Responsible for the management of all active sales processes within the team, ensuring co-ordination of company resource in an optimal and effective manner in support of these processes.

**KEY TASKS:**


* To manage the performance of the sales team on a daily basis, co-ordinating resource, monitoring activity, and where necessary initiating corrective action to ensure sustainable delivery of results.
* To manage sales opportunities through direct reports
* To liaise closely with the VP Sales, other sales leaders and the operations / enablement team in pursuance of a consistent approach to sales/product/commercial strategy.
* Will submit the relevant management reports in a timely manner including up to date forecasting information.

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Will work under own initiative for day-to-day workload in line with overall strategy and guidelines.
* Will work through direct reports for specific requirements.
* Will be expected to influence members of staff where no direct line authority is in place.
* Responsible for the direction of the sales team with regard to training, compensation, motivation, development and resourcing.
* Will be expected to play a key role in the sales management team.

**SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE:**


* Will have the ability to anticipate, identify and analyse problems and opportunities, establish priorities and efficiently allocate and utilise resource.
* Will have acquired an in-depth knowledge of commercial/sales issues preferably within a payroll/HR software or service environment.
* Must be able to delegate and co-ordinate workloads to achieve overall objectives within specified time and budget.
* Will be able to review and measure progress against specific criteria and take necessary corrective action where appropriate.
* Must demonstrate sufficient flexibility to be able to adapt and respond to the meet the needs of shifting goals.
* Must be able to demonstrate excellent communication skills, personal integrity and a positive attitude in all dealings with colleagues/clients.

**EXPERIENCE NEEDED:**


* Experience managing a remote field-based sales team
* Experience leading new business teams with a target focus of selling to Mid Market/Enterprise level customers
* Evidence of coaching sales team to perform using a structured sales process and methodologies
* SaaS / HCM / Tech solution sales experience of 5+ years
* Examples of coaching top sales performers to achieve target, and achieve deals in the region of €100k + ARR
* Based in / close to Stockholm with full right to work and driving licence

**What We Offer:**


* Highly competitive salary and compensation plan
* An on-going, individualised, world class induction programme - offering both local and international training and development
* Realistic targets + valuable offerings = real earnings. We like to see our associates overachieving, and celebrate this regularly with early starts, quarterly and annual awards, clubs and trips. Recent ones include;
* + A 5-star stay in Buenos Aires
	+ A luxury cruise around Greece
* Excellent support teams to help you get there!
* A sales team and presence in Stockholm and the Nordics – you are not alone!

Flexible benefits program  
* 

If this sounds like you and what you're looking for, or if you'd like to learn more, then please do get in touch!


Sales Manager, Sales Leader, New Business Sales, Sales Management, Software as a Service, SaaS, Human Resources, HR, Human Capital Management, HCM, Cloud Software


**A little about ADP:** We are a comprehensive global provider of cloud-based human capital management (HCM) solutions that unite HR, payroll, talent, time, tax and benefits administration and a leader in business outsourcing services, analytics, and compliance expertise. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating a down-to-earth culture that embraces our core values, welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition for our work by many esteemed organizations, learn more at ADP Awards and Recognition.


**Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Equal Employment Opportunity at ADP:** ADP is committed to an inclusive, diverse and equitable workplace, and is further committed to providing equal employment opportunities regardless of any protected characteristic including: race, color, genetic information, creed, national origin, religion, sex, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, lawful alien status, ancestry, age, marital status, protected veteran status or disability. Hiring decisions are based upon ADP’s operating needs, and applicant merit including, but not limited to, qualifications, experience, ability, availability, cooperation, and job performance.


**Ethics at ADP:** ADP has a long, proud history of conducting business with the highest ethical standards and full compliance with all applicable laws. We also expect our people to uphold our values with the highest level of integrity and behave in a manner that fosters an honest and respectful workplace. Click https://jobs.adp.com/life-at-adp/ to learn more about ADP’s culture and our full set of values.
company_description: We create experiences, products, and services that people love using every day.

title: Nattreceptionister med erfarenhet från Opera, MEWS & HMS
description:
**Om jobbet:** Nattreceptionist på varierande arbetsplatser i Stockholm. Vi bemannar Stockholms mest attraktiva hotell med alltifrån enstaka pass till längre uppdrag. Arbeta när det passar dig och på den arbetsplats du trivs bäst. Arbetet är nattetid och varierar om du arbetar själv på hotellet eller med kollegor. Tjänsten passar dig som vill kombinera med studier eller annat arbete.
  
Vem är du? Är du en nattuggla som trivs bäst när alla andra sover? Arbetar du kanske redan på ett hotell som nattreceptionist men vill arbeta extra under din lediga vecka? Vi söker dig som har minst 1 års erfarenhet från hotellreception och känner dig trygg med något av följande bokningssystem: Opera, Opera Cloud, Mews, Hotsoft, HMS. Som person ser vi att du är flexibel, serviceminded och ordningsam. Du behöver kunna kommunicera obehindrat på engelska i tal och skrift. Varför ska du jobba på RestaurangAssistans? Att jobba hos oss är framförallt väldigt roligt! Vem vill inte ha hundratals härliga kollegor och möjlighet att jobba på massor av spännande arbetsplatser?
  
Erfarenhet - Hos oss får du snabbt erfarenheter som annars tar flera år att uppnå. Jobba på allt från en till 30 olika arbetsplatser, hos oss finns alla möjligheter! Lär känna nya branschkollegor och skaffa dig ett brett nätverk i branschen!
  
Flexibelt schema - Jobba eller vara ledig? Hos oss får du sms-förfrågningar och väljer själv hur mycket, när och vart du vill jobba. Vi erbjuder både heltid, deltid och extraanställningar!
  
Personalaktiviteter - Få vänner för livet! Vi hittar på massa kul tillsammans för att stärka gemenskapen och visa vår uppskattning.
  
Friskvård och förmåner – Vi erbjuder alla våra anställda oavsett anställningsgrad rabatterade träningskort. Vi erbjuder även rabatt på hotellvistelser i hela Norden!
  
Utbildning - Flera gånger per år anordnar vi utbildningar på olika nivåer. Vi har också ett samarbete med externa parter, bl.a. Restaurangakademien.
  
Trygga och bra villkor med kollektivavtal - Hos oss ingår allt, försäkring, pension och semesterersättning. Dessutom så får du en konkurrenskraftig lön samt tillägg för obekväma arbetstider. Mer om oss RestaurangAssistans är Nordens ledande bemanningsföretag inom besöksnäringen. Vi har funnits i över 20 år och har kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Oslo. Vi bemannar, rekryterar och outsourcar personal till hotellkedjor, stjärnkrogar, företagsrestauranger, kommuner, konferensanläggningar, cateringföretag och stora Arenor.
  
Våra ledord är effektivitet, kvalitet, flexibilitet och omtanke.

title: Data Scientist
description:
**About Norla:**  

Norla is an IT and management consulting company driven by customer satisfaction. We work in a multicultural environment and are guided by our principle of "Mind and Heart." We prioritize that our relationships with our employees ensure their professional growth and success. Together, we collaborate with a network of major actors to discover the best talents to support our clients.
  
You'll work on NLP, time series forecasting, and machine learning projects, collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive real impact.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Develop and deploy machine learning models, with a focus on NLP, time series forecasting, and deep learning.
  
Build and manage end-to-end ML pipelines using MLflow, and cloud platforms.
  
Design A/B tests and experiments to optimize business strategies.
  
Work with data engineering teams to ensure efficient data pipelines.
  
Analyze large datasets to extract insights for e-commerce and retail applications.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

5+ years of experience in machine learning and data science.
  
Strong Python skills, with experience in Scikit-learn, PyTorch, and ML frameworks.
  
Expertise in Natural Language Processing (NLP) and Large Language Models (LLMs) (e.g., LangChain).
  
Experience with time series forecasting, A/B testing, and statistical modeling.
  
Hands-on experience with SQL, Tableau, and cloud platforms (AWS/GCP).
  
Background in e-commerce or retail is a plus.

title: Customer Success Manager - Sports Performance
description:
We are looking for a Customer Success Manager to join the Spiideo team!
  
Spiideo is a global leader in automated, cloud-based solutions for sports video analysis and streaming. Trusted by thousands of organizations worldwide, Spiideo serves some of the most renowned professional and collegiate teams, media companies, and leagues and federations.
  
Join the Customer Success team if you would love the opportunity to manage some of the top sports organizations across Europe.
  
This role is based in Malmö, Sweden and you will report directly to the VP of Customer Success.
  
  

**The role:**  

You will manage a portfolio of Media companies, Leagues, and Sports clubs in Europe with a primary focus in Southern Europe markets (Spain, Italy, etc.). Fluency in Spanish and Italian is required to effectively manage the Spain and Italian markets.
  
  

**Core responsibilities:**  

**Onboarding & Training:** help new customers get onboarded with Spiideo
  
**Customer Satisfaction:** delivering exceptional guidance, maximize potential
  
**Renewals:** proactive management to achieve company renewal targets
  
**Upsell & Expansion:** identify opportunities to maximize and expand usage
  
**Churn management:** proactively engage to reduce churn and ensure success
  
**Relationship building:** cultivate strong, trusted partnerships with key stakeholders
  
**Process development:** ability to coordinate and manage complex implementations
  
  

What type of customers would you manage?
  
You will manage a portfolio of Sports clubs, Leagues, and Media companies (in market) across a variety of sports (Football, Ice Hockey, Basketball, Handball, etc.) across the entire Spiideo portfolio: Spiideo Perform (video analysis), Spiideo Play (streaming), and Spiideo Replay (VAR).
  
Leagues
  
Professional sports clubs
  
Media Companies
  
  

**What we are looking for:**  

Prior Customer Success or Sales experience (at least 2 years)
  
Professional proficiency in Spanish, Italian and English, both written and spoken
  
Sports tech industry is a bonus
  
Very process-driven and structured approach to working
  
Self-motivated, takes initiative, positive, team-first attitude
  
Excellent ability to train customers via Webinars, 1on1 meetings, etc.
  
Strong problem solving skills
  
Excellent communication and presentation skills
  
Passion for customer success and get joy out of seeing our customers succeed
  
  

**What we can offer:**  

The chance to make an impact in a growing, international SaaS company.
  
A friendly and skilled multinational team
  
Access to cutting-edge tools and resources to empower your work.
  
Benefits package that includes an extensive pension & insurance package in line with collective agreements, wellness contribution, parental leave benefits and the opportunity to spend two working hours per week on physical activity.
  
  

**Location:** Spiideo's office at Lilla Torg 1 in Malmö
  
**Remote status:** Office first (Hybrid, minimum 3 days in Malmö office per week)
  
Application
  
You will be part of an international team with knowledgable and friendly people from many different nationalities and backgrounds. We welcome applicants from all backgrounds to contribute their unique perspectives, skills, and experiences, fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce across Spiideo.
  
We believe that when the best people work together in an open environment, magic happens. Apply now and become an integral part of our success story! We review new applications continuously.

title: Senior Financial Controller – Interimuppdrag inom en global verksamhet
description:
Vi söker en senior Financial Controller för ett spännande uppdrag inom en internationell organisation. I denna roll får du en central position där du ansvarar för IFRS16-bokföring, accounts payable-processer och förbättringsarbete. Är du analytisk, strukturerad och har erfarenhet av komplexa verksamheter? Då kan detta vara rätt uppdrag för dig!
  
  

**Som Financial Controller kommer du att:**  

Ansvara för IFRS16-bokföring, där delar av arbetet sker löpande under månaden och i samband med bokslut. Hantera och utveckla accounts payable (AP)-flödet, i samarbete med en outsourcingpartner. Driva förbättringsprojekt kopplade till AP-processen och IFRS16. Ansvara för ICFR-kontroller och säkerställa regelefterlevnad. Arbeta med systemintegrationer och datahantering för att effektivisera processer.
  
Krav
  
Mycket goda kunskaper i Excel, med erfarenhet av att hantera stora datamängder. Erfarenhet av accounts payable-processer och förståelse för IFRS16. Djup kunskap inom svenska redovisningsregelverk (K3) och IFRS. Erfarenhet av att arbeta i större bolag med komplex verksamhet och systemmiljö. Vana att arbeta med shared service centers. Strukturerad och deadline-orienterad, med stark analytisk förmåga.
  
Tekniska kunskaper
  
  

**Erfarenhet av:**  

* Oracle Fusion Cloud, Oracle EPM Cloud/FCC, Coupa, andra försystem • Hantering av IFRS16-filer och systeminläsning • Meriterande med kunskap i Power Query


Personliga egenskaper
  
Kommunikativ och samarbetsorienterad – Du har många kontaktytor inom finans, verksamhet och koncernbolag. Självgående och lösningsorienterad – Du driver processer framåt med ett proaktivt förhållningssätt. Noggrann och analytisk – Du ser detaljerna men har också förmågan att förstå helheten.
  
Praktisk information
  
**Period:** 2025-04-08 – 2026-07-31 Ort: Stockholm Distansarbete: 25 % Sista ansökningsdag: 19 mars 2025
  
**Kontaktperson:** 0790 062 711
  
Vi arbetar med löpande urval, så ansök så snart som möjligt! Är du redo för nästa steg i din karriär? Hör av dig!
  
Sway Sourcing är en innovativ rekryteringspartner som specialiserar sig på att matcha rätt talang med rätt företag – snabbt och effektivt. Vårt huvudfokus ligger inom Ekonomi, Administration, HR, Marknad och IT, men vi har även den breda expertis och flexibilitet som krävs för att leverera skräddarsydda rekryteringslösningar inom alla branscher.
  
Trots att vi är en relativt ny aktör har vi redan byggt förtroende hos många av Sveriges största företag och arbetar både nationellt och internationellt. Med baser i Sverige och Spanien erbjuder vi en unik kombination av lokal expertis och global räckvidd. Vårt starka nätverk och djupa branschinsikter gör oss till en självklar partner för företag som vill ligga steget före i sin rekrytering.

title: BDR Internship - Launch Your Sales & Business Development Career
description:
- Devoteam G Cloud is an award-winning Google Cloud partner renowned for its innovative and collaborative culture. With a team of over 600 Google Cloud experts, we deliver cutting-edge solutions to businesses across the globe. Our Stockholm office is a dynamic hub for technological advancement, and we're looking for driven individuals to join our growing team.

  
Are you eager to kickstart your career in sales and business development? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy connecting with people? This BDR internship offers an unparalleled opportunity to gain hands-on experience at the forefront of the technology industry.


**As a BDR Intern, you will:**

* **Drive business growth:** Play a key role in identifying and qualifying potential clients, generating leads, and contributing to the company's sales pipeline.
* **Develop key sales skills:** Master the art of outreach, including crafting compelling cold emails and conducting engaging cold calls to connect with prospects.
* **Become a trusted advisor:** Build relationships with potential clients, understand their business challenges, and position Devoteam G Cloud's solutions effectively.
* **Collaborate with sales professionals:** Work closely with our experienced sales team to develop and execute targeted outreach strategies.
* **Contribute to sales strategy:** Participate in sales meetings, contribute to account planning sessions, and gain insights into the sales process from lead generation to close.
* **Gain market intelligence:** Research target industries and identify key decision-makers to expand Devoteam G Cloud's reach.

  
* Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in business, marketing, or a related field.
* Exceptional communication, interpersonal, and presentation skills.
* A strong desire to learn and a passion for sales and business development.
* Self-motivated and results-oriented with a proactive approach.
* Interest in technology and cloud computing is a plus.

  
- **What You Gain:**


	* **Comprehensive sales experience:** Gain valuable experience across all stages of the sales cycle, from lead generation to relationship building and closing deals.
	* **Mentorship from sales leaders:** Learn from experienced sales professionals and receive guidance to develop your skills and advance your career.
	* **Networking opportunities:** Build connections with industry leaders and expand your professional network within the technology sector.
	* **Cutting-edge knowledge:** Gain insight into the world of cloud computing and the latest Google Cloud technologies.
	* **Launchpad for your career:** This internship provides a strong foundation for a successful career in sales and business development within a dynamic and growing company.**Additional Information:**

This is an unpaid internship opportunity based in our Stockholm office.


**Apply Now!**

Submit your CV along with a motivational letter explaining why you're the perfect fit for Devoteam G Cloud and your aspirations for a career in sales and business development.
